name: Moravia
startIntroPart1: O, wise Rostislav, may your reign be glorious as the beauty of the shining sun over the Moravian meadows.
startIntroPart2: May your people be gifted with wisdom, as they are with the sword. Good luck and farewell.
introduction: I am Rostislav, God's servant. I hope we will get along fine.
declaringWar: May God have mercy on you, for I won't.
attacked: I pity your people for the fool they have as a leader
afterPeace: What do you ask of, heathen?
defeated: May my people forgive me, oh, for I was defeated by a heathen.
neutralYes: It was a pleasure doing business with you.
hateNo: I cannot accept this, for you are such a disgrace to the world.
hateYes: We may not get along, heathen, but I have to accept this for the sake of my people.

name: Hungary
startIntroPart1: Sigismund, may your rule be just and wise. Lead your people wisely, and surely the Pearl of the Danube will shine the brightest.
startIntroPart2: The beauties of your land are known far and wide. Now it is upon you, to lead this great country once again. Farewell
declaringWar: Your people will suffer at the hands of my brothers
attacked: HA! You think your mere army of pitiful fools can defeat me?
afterPeace: What do you ask of, heathen?
defeated: Curses! How could I lose to a fool?
neutralYes: It was a pleasure doing business with you.
hateNo: I cannot accept this, for you are such a disgrace to the world.
hateYes: We may not get along, heathen, but I have to accept this for the sake of my people.

name: Serbia
startIntroPart1: O great leader Stefan, may your reign be marked by might and joy. Blessings upon you, God's servant.
startIntroPart2: It is time to lead the Serbs once again. May you rise to glory and farewell.
introduction: Dusan's my name and I serve the Lord.
attacked: Very well then, If you think you've got what it takes to defeat Serbia.
afterPeace: What do you ask of, heathen?
defeated: Curses! How could I lose to a fool?
neutralYes: It was a pleasure doing business with you.
hateNo: I cannot accept this, for you are such a disgrace to the world.
hateYes: We may not get along, heathen, but I have to accept this for the sake of my people.
uniques: [+1 Culture] [+1 Faith] from [Plains], starts with [Agriculture], [+1 Happiness] from [Farm]

name: Judea
startIntroPart1: O great servant of God, you are chosen to be the shepherd of your people. Lead them wisely and the Judean civilization will flourish.
startIntroPart2: Oh, great king, tales of your wisdom have been widespread around the Middle East and Mediterannean. Will you once again prove your worth? Will you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Your false Gods have abandoned you.
attacked: HA! I have defeated Goliath, I can surely defeat a foolish foe like you.
afterPeace: Although we are at peace, I still want to see you defeated.
tradeRequest: I know you want this trade, I'm sure of that.
hateNo: How could you think of such a thing!?
hateYes: I only accept because I have to.

name: Italy
startIntroPart1: O, wise Rostislav, may your reign be glorious as the beauty of the shining sun over the Moravian meadows.
startIntroPart2: May your people be gifted with wisdom, as they are with the sword. Good luck and farewell.

declaringWar: May God have mercy on you, for I won't.
attacked: I pity your people for the fool they have as a leader
afterPeace: What do you ask of, heathen?
defeated: May my people forgive me, oh, for I was defeated by a heathen.
neutralYes: It was a pleasure doing business with you.
hateNo: I cannot accept this, for you are such a disgrace to the world.
hateYes: We may not get along, heathen, but I have to accept this for the sake of my people.
